intro: Melhania leprieurii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant purple, pink, or white blooms, which are often borne on tall, erect stems. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Melhania leprieurii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
